column4: Have someone an idea how i can get the dns server from dhcp, but not change the configuration of my interfaces?
you tell the dhcp server to offer dns servers, however it is very unnormal to do this without offering an IP
i can't change anything on the dhcp server    i only can ask him for the dns servers ^^
why are you trying to do this /
I would not insert the dns servers not into my resolv,conf but in my "/etc/bind/named.conf.options" as forwarders
that is not a dhcp option
dhcp does not configure names.conf
ok, so what exactly are you trying to do and why ?
i write an script that gets the dns servers from dhcp and write it to the bind conf as forwarders
do the dns servers change from dhcp or are they the same ones you get each time ?
i have something like an router. the router provides an dns server and must provide all dns informations behind him (forwarders). And the router moves from one network to another
this does not sound lke a good solution
what would be a better one?
running a dns server on a changing ip network  is not good
the network on the "lan" side does not change    only on the "wan" side
that is bad then, you should not be running a local dns server on a machine that is changing WAN hosts
use the dns servers provided for you, rather than running a local one
the local one is a must have. else it would not be possible to reach the webinterface of this "router" with "www.example.local"
sorry, I disagree and I disagree with the solution.
i have not found a better solution. but if you have an idea it would be nice :)
just put an entry in your host file
can i change the host file on a other system over dhcp?
no, but then you can't change anything over DHCP as you said you can't change the dhcp server
